definition: to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point

sentences.english: The boy plays up his strong points and minimizes his weaknesses.
sentences.chinese: 这男孩夸大自己的长处，极力缩小自己的缺点。

sentences.english: Its advantages are simple geometry, radial load carrying capacity and high.
sentences.chinese: 它的长处是复杂的几何体，径向负荷承载才能和高。

sentences.english: Then focus on your strengths but don’t overdo it.
sentences.chinese: 利用你的长处但是不要做的过火。

sentences.english: “Isaw that George was an asset, ” Mr. Abraham said.
sentences.chinese: “我看到了乔治的长处，”亚伯拉罕说到。

sentences.english: Every archetype has strengths, weaknesses, gifts, and fears.
sentences.chinese: 每一个原型都有自己的长处，短处，天性，和恐惧。

sentences.english: Self-deprivation is no longer a virtue.
sentences.chinese: 自我约束不再是长处了。

sentences.english: Teams work together so they can improve their strengths and abilities.
sentences.chinese: 团队要一起行动，这样他们才能发挥长处和能力。

sentences.english: The wise old Mother Superior was dying.
sentences.chinese: 睿智的老女修道院长处在了弥留之际。

sentences.english: Domesticating translation also has its advantages and its due range of usage.
sentences.chinese: 同样，归化的翻译策略也有其长处和适用的范围。

sentences.english: Self-confidence, optimism and calmness are strong points in my personality.
sentences.chinese: 自信，乐观，沉着冷静是我的性格长处。

sentences.english: As is known to all, fake and inferior commodities harm the interests of consumers.
sentences.chinese: 众所周知，冒充伪劣商品损害了消耗者的长处。

sentences.english: Recognize your strengths, even if you have to list all of them down.
sentences.chinese: 认清你的长处，即便是这需要你列出一张清单来发现。

sentences.english: I:  What do you consider your strenghts?
sentences.chinese: 那你认为你有什么长处？

sentences.english: They are strengths you have, often from birth.
sentences.chinese: 这些是你的长处，往往是天生的。

sentences.english: Pluses and minuses to both vehicles but I am attracted by the more luxurious interior of the QX.
sentences.chinese: 两个长处和短处车，但我吸引更豪华的室内QX。

definition: personal strength/one's special ability or strong points
to foster strengths and avoid weaknesses (idiom)/to play to one's strengths
lit. use others' strengths to make up for one's weak points (idiom from Mencius)/to use this in place of that/what you lose on the swings, you win on the roundabouts
lit. for some things a foot may be too short, and for the other an inch will suffice (proverb)/fig. everyone has their strong and weak points/everything has its advantages and disadvantages
pinyin: chi3 you3 suo3 duan3 , cun4 you3 suo3 chang2

definition: to be good at/to be adept at
expert at appointing people according to their abilities (idiom)/to put the right people in the right places
